item.description:
WAR - Lonnie Jordan
http://wartheband.com...
103.3 WODS FREE Summer Concert Series
http://wods.radio.com...

Kicking off this year’s Summer Concert Series is the legendary 70s funk band WAR! Some of WAR’s hits include ‘Low Rider’, ‘Why Can’t We Be Friends’ and ‘Spill The Wine’!

The year was 1969, and these 'kids' had the nerve to carry the name WAR at a time when peace was the slogan in an anti-Vietnam America. "Our mission was to spread a message of brotherhood and harmony," states WAR founder, singer/keyboardist Lonnie Jordan. "Our instruments and voices became our weapons of choice and the songs our ammunition. We spoke out against racism, hunger, gangs, crimes, and turf wars, as we embraced all people with hope and the spirit of brotherhood. It's just as apropos today"

Lonnie Jordan is also the Musical Director of the upcoming documentary, "B.A.D. - Black American Diet" http://thebadmovie.co... His wife and Executive Producer of B.A.D., Teresa Jordan, wrote the ebook, "SECRETS to a 5 Day FUN Juice Fast!" http://lulu.com/produ...





Please Note the following:
*All shows begin at 7pm rain or shine
*No alcohol
*No grilling

Directions: The Hatch Shell is located on the East End of Storrow Drive, not far from the Mass General Hospital. By public transport: Take any MBTA Red Line train to the Charles Street/MGH station. Take the footbridge over Storrow Drive to the Charles River side and go West along Storrow Drive. The Hatch Shell is a short walk from here. Alternatively, take any Green Line train to the Arlington Street Station. Walk along the Public Garden/Arlington Street to Beacon Street. Cross over Beacon Street and take the Arthur Fiedler Footbridge over Storrow Drive to the Hatch Shell. Go to google.com for a map to the DCR Hatch Shell.

Parking: It is recommended that concert-goers take the T for easier, quicker access. If you do drive, parking is available near the Hatch Shell at a number of local parking garages. Equity Residential is offering a special deal on parking at the 4 Emerson Place Garage for WODS listeners!

Go to Prana Cafe before or after the concert for take out: http://thepranacafe.c...

(posted by http://essenic.com...)
item.name: WAR - FREE Concert
